content: abbreviations evenly between 3 needles x n = repeat sequence in brackets n times round 1 join in the round k1 p1 to end to end means to repeat until the end of the round 2 k1 p1 to end row beg = beginning round 3 k2 m1 x 9 27 sts co = cast on round 4-8 work 5 row in st st k = knit round 9 k1 k2tog x 9 18 sts k2tog = decrease 1 by knitting 2 together round 10 knit m1 = increase 1 by picking up loop between stitch just worked and next stitch from front round 11 k2tog x 9 9 sts to back and knit into the back of this loop round 12 knit mb = make bobble round 13 k1 k2tog x 3 6 sts step 1 increase 5 sts into next st knit into front then back front back front of st turn cut yarn thread end through remaining sts 5 sts and pull tight to gather secure yarn ends step 2 p5 turn step 3 k5 turn step 4 p2tog p1 p2tog turn 3 sts finishing step 5 s2kp 1 st if you re not using safety eyes embroider eyes bobble is finished so continue with the with black yarn embroider a nose with the remainder of the row pink yarn p = purl experiment with the placement of the ears p2tog = decrease 1 stitch by purling 2 stitches together and hat before attaching any parts sew the rs = right side bound-off edge of the ears to the head or hat s1 = slip one stitch from left-hand needle to sew the hat onto the head sew the head to right-hand needle the bound-off edge of the body with the seam s2kp = decrease 2 by slipping 2 stitches as if facing down secure all yarn ends to k2tog knit the next stitch then pass both braided tail cut three 30 cm 12 lengths of slipped stitches over the knit stitch your mc yarn thread them one at a time ssk = decrease 1 by slipping 2 stitches purl- wise then knit slipped stitches together under a couple stitches at the lower centre- st or sts = stitch or stitches back of your toy pull each strand half-way st st = stockinette stitch knit on rs purl on through so the ends match up separate the ws strands into three groups of 2 then ws = wrong side plait/braid together tightly for 8 cm 3 secure the ends with a tight overhand knot then trim ends if you re hanging the mouse on a tree add a loop of yarn or ribbon to the top of the head/hat 4 5
